H0.text: From the Greek word sphygm贸s, meaning pulse, what is the inflatable cuff pressure meter called which measures human blood pressure. Pulseometer

H1.text: From the Greek word sphygm贸s, meaning pulse, what is the inflatable cuff pressure meter called which measures human blood pressure. Cardiometer

H2.text: From the Greek word sphygm贸s, meaning pulse, what is the inflatable cuff pressure meter called which measures human blood pressure. Pressometer

H3.text: From the Greek word sphygm贸s, meaning pulse, what is the inflatable cuff pressure meter called which measures human blood pressure. Sphygmometer

A4.text: A sphygmomanometer is a device used to measure blood pressure.

A5.text: The word sphygmomanometer uses the combining form of sphygmo- + manometer.

A6.text: The 1951 patent titled 'Sphygmomanometer' was issued for an inflatable cuff blood-pressure measuring device.

A8.text: The auscultatory method (from the Latin word for 'listening') uses a stethoscope and a sphygmomanometer.

A9.text: Arterial pressure is most commonly measured via a sphygmomanometer, which uses the height of a column of mercury, or an aneroid gauge, to reflect the blood pressure by auscultation.

A10.text: the taking of blood pressure through a sphygmomanometer

A11.text: the invention of the cuff-based sphygmomanometer by Scipione Riva-Rocci in 1896
